com.mappedin.sdk

Class Analytics

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mappedin.sdk.Analytics

  • public class Analytics
extends java.lang.Object
    The Analytics class is a singleton for sending analytics data to the Mappedin CMS. Some analytics events are fired automatically, but you are responsible for sending selectedLocation and selectedCategory, and they should also be fired in other parts of your app, even when the Map is not visible. This will make Smart Search work better for your venues.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Analytics getInstance()
        Returns an instance of the Analytics class. Because it is a singleton, only one instance per VM will be created
        Returns:
        the instance of the Analytics

      • selectedLocation

        public void selectedLocation(Location location)
        Informs the Mappedin Analytics platform that a given location has been "selected". This events needs to be fired when the user is browsing and taps on a location on the map, or picks it from list, such a directory listing or a search result. It should not be fired if the user taps on a polygon to indicate it is the start of their journey when wayfinding.
        Parameters:
        location - the selected Location

      • selectedCategory

        public void selectedCategory(Category category)
        Informs the Mappedin Analytics platform that a given category has been "selected". This should be fired when the user selects a category in a list, anywhere in your application.
        Parameters:
        category - the selected Category

      • startedWayfind

        public Analytics.Wayfind startedWayfind(Location location)
        Informs the Mappedin Analytics platform that a way find action has been started. This should be fired when the user start way finding.
        Parameters:
        location - the destination Location
        Returns:
        Analytics.Wayfind
